30 30

Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouver’s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

The Timeline

Before 1983

Penatibus nec lorem montes adipiscing porttitor augue quis pulvinar velit et? Penatibus nec lorem montes adipiscing porttitor augue quis pulvinar velit et?

1983

Five gay men, who recognized a looming crisis, conceived AIDS Vancouver in 1983 at a dinner party.

1984

AIDS Vancouver’s first community forum brought Paul Popham of the Gay Men’s Health Crisis in NYC and was attended by many including, 'Patient Zero', Gaetan Dugas.

1985

Three Cherry Trees were planted in Stanley Park in honour of some of the first few individuals who died of AIDS-related illnesses in Vancouver.

1986

Our community recognized early on the importance of a consumer-based organizations by and for people living with AIDS.

1987

Alan Herbert, former Chair of the Board of Directors speaks to funding AIDS Vancouver in a time of crisis.

1988

A beautiful love story involving Vancouver’s Miss Alternate drag queen, Billy Jean Queen, and BC Civil Liberties lawyer Michael Vonn.

1989

The story of the City of Vancouver’s measured public health response early in in the HIV/AIDS crisis and our Medical Health Officer who championed it.

AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.
Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver
  • 30th Anniversary RSVP
  • Donate
  • Acknowledgements

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services.

Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
